title.narrative: Strengthening capacities in Information Management for NNGOs Protection Humanitarian Actors in north-east Nigeria.

description.narrative:
iMMAP started the information management training and capacity building program in Nigeria in 2017. Under the program, iMMAP works hand in hand with the humanitarian sector coordinators and the UN Oﬃce for the Coordination of Humanitarian Aﬀairs (UNOCHA) to identify priority information management capacity building needs, design training activities, identify participants, deliver the local capacity building activities and provide information management direct support to clusters. This activity is made possible through the support received from the US Agency for International Development Oﬃce of Foreign Disaster Assistance (USAID/ OFDA). In order to complement this effort, iMMAP proposes to set up a 8 months project which will focus on supporting protection humanitarian actors with information management capacity building, harmonizing amp standardizing tools, to improve quality of data analysis leading to a better planned response. In 2018, iMMAP conducted a Capacity Building Needs Assessment, and since then delivered ten rounds of IM capacity building training to actors across the humanitarian spectrum, in addition to two rounds of Training of Trainers (ToT) that was developed based on the Impact Monitoring Survey of iMMAP’s support to the Humanitarian Sectors conducted in August 2018.
Through this project,6 rounds of capacity building training and a coaching program will be conducted in field information management, data collection amp data analysis. The capacity building program will target National NGOs (NNGOs) who are implementing protection related interventions and based in Borno State.
The Capacity Building package will come in the form of two themes: 1. Information management (IM) Capacity Strengthening of Protection partners through training delivery: a. IM Capacity assessment of existing protection NNGOs. b. Identification of priority needs and topics c. Delivery of two specialized training sessions to three groups (total 6 rounds) in core information management pertaining to the humanitarian context to the identified partners. d. Evaluation of the impact of the training program.
2. Bilateral coaching program to partners with end-to-end information management services such as (but not limited to) assessment tool design, data cleaning/aggregation/anonymization, database design and management, visualization and analysis/GIS: a. Prioritization assessment to identify organizations to be targeted b. Identification of priority partners c. Delivery of coaching sessions for partners’ personnel. d. Evaluation of the impact of the coaching program.
